The Right Reverend Al Sharpton last night at the Democratic National Convention spoke the truth when he said, "...We're gonna ride this Donkey as far as it'll carry us!"
 
 That is, quaintly put, the welfare recipients goal...to ride the government.

Since when is Al Sharpton a welfare recipient? 
 
 Unless you're making a huge generalization about all black people, in which case you would be a racist a$$hole, and should probably go kill yourself.

Since when is Al Sharpton a welfare recipient? 
 
 Unless you're making a huge generalization about all black people, in which case you would be a racist a$$hole, and should probably go kill yourself.

 
 Not at all. The Democrats push for give-aways that all welfare recipients, white or black, will sell their vote for.
 
 You brought out the black/white card, not I.
Why, when Sharpton said "we" you took it to mean welfare recipients?

Why, when Sharpton said "we" you took it to mean welfare recipients?

 
 He's trolling, don't fall for it.
 
 Actually, he's given the Democrats a compliment here. Three days of speeches, and this is the best dig he could come up with. Clearly the Dems are a bunch of superior speakers, with wonderfull ideas and brilliant vision, to pose such poor targets for jim's scorn.

Why, when Sharpton said "we" you took it to mean welfare recipients?

 Actually, he's given the Democrats a compliment here. Three days of speeches, and this is the best dig he could come up with. Clearly the Dems are a bunch of superior speakers, with wonderfull ideas and brilliant vision, to pose such poor targets for jim's scorn.

 
 No, that's not the best dig. I did leave my notes at home though.
 
 Clinton's speech was well delivered but not entirely accurate. Bob Graham's was pathetic. Steve Brozak made a few mistakes. I slept through Edwards'. I missed Jesse Jackson's because he's not "prime time" anymore. The Governor of Michigan recognized that she had to speak v e r y p l a i n l y to get the delegate to understand, and then they didn't pay her much attention.

Since when is Al Sharpton a welfare recipient? 
 
 Unless you're making a huge generalization about all black people, in which case you would be a racist a$$hole, and should probably go kill yourself.

 
 
 That would actually be prejudging them, not being racist towards them. If he would have said he hated all blacks and they were all on welfare, then it would be racist. And I believe he said "welfare recipients", not blacks. Why did you jump to that conclusion?
 
 
 Also, Ron Reagan had by far the worst speech of the whole convention. I thought it was the DNC, not Ron Reagan's personal time to expose his plans on stem cell research. His speech can be summed up into 1 word: atrocious.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Rev. Al Charlatan speaks the "truth"!
